sen.j: 伊東 祐親（いとう すけちか、生年不詳 - 寿永元年2月15日 (旧暦)（1182年3月21日））は平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Sukechika ITO (born on an unknown date, died in March 21, 1182) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) at the end of the Heian period.
Sukechika ITO (date of birth unknown, died on March 21, 1182) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) at the end of the Heian period.

sen.e: Sukechika ITO (year of birth unknown - March 21, 1182) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) at the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 父は藤原南家の流れを汲む伊豆国の豪族伊東祐家。
sen.e: His father was Sukeie ITO who was a member of gozoku (local ruling family) in Izu Province descended from Fujiwara-Nanke (the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan).
sen.cmt: ＊「伊東祐家」の読み方は下記出典を参照に「いとうすけいえ」といたしました。もともと伊東祐家は工藤家ゆかりのため（父は工藤祐隆）、工藤祐家と記載されることもあるようです。http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=TdcFH1Wn7GEC&pg=PA155&dq=ito+sukeie&hl=ja&ei=VjGPTPXBC9Skcfbc7OIM&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDoQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=ito%20sukei＊藤原南家の対訳は用語登録を参照しましたが、読み仮名もローマ字表記で翻訳し、用語登録対訳はカッコ内に入れて訳しました。
sen.e: His father was Sukeie ITO who was a member of gozoku (local ruling family) in Izu Province descended from Fujiwara-Nanke (the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan).
His father was Sukeie ITO who was a member of gozoku (local ruling family) in Izu Province descended from the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: Fujiwara-Nanke を削除しました。（統一リストにしたがいました）

sen.j: 子に河津祐泰、伊東祐清、女子（三浦義澄室）、八重姫、ほか。
sen.e: Children of Sukechika ITO were Sukeyasuu KAWAZU, Sukekiyo ITO, a girl (the wife of Yoshizumi MIURA), Yaehime, and some others.

sen.j: 東国における親伊勢平氏方豪族として平清盛からの信頼を受け、平治元年（1159年）の平治の乱に敗れて伊豆に配流されてきた源頼朝の監視を任される。
sen.e: Sukechika ITO was put in charge of watching MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who was defeated in the Heiji War in 1159 and was exiled to Izu Province, because he was trusted by TAIRA no Kiyomori as a member of gozoku in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) who was siding with Ise-Heishi (a branch of the Taira clan).
sen.cmt: ＊「伊勢平氏」：辞書などの調査にて、平氏の一派である（清盛を輩出した派）とわかりましたため、カッコ内意訳の部分が、Ise-Heishi (a branch of the Taira clan)との記載のほうが良いのかもしれないとも考え、そのように訳しました。伊勢平氏：参考：http://dictionary.goo.ne.jp/leaf/jn2/11783/m0u/%E4%BC%8A%E5%8B%A2%E5%B9%B3%E6%B0%8F/http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=bmNLkWEb-jkC&pg=PA393&dq=ise+heishi+branch&hl=ja&ei=6i-QTJ3XEsOpcev_sfoM&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=4&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=ise%20heishi%2平氏の様々な流派：参考：http://www.weblio.jp/content/%E5%B9%B3%E6%B0%8Fhttp://www6.plala.or.jp/HEIKE-RAISAN/keifu/keifu1.html
sen.e: Sukechika ITO was put in charge of watching MINAMOTO no Yoritomo who was defeated in the Heiji War in 1159 and was exiled to Izu Province, because he was trusted by TAIRA no Kiyomori as a member of gozoku in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region) who was pro-Ise-Heishi (a branch of the Taira clan).

sen.j: しかし祐親の娘八重姫は、頼朝と通じて一子千鶴丸を儲けるまでの仲になってしまう。
sen.e: However, Yaehime, the daughter of Sukechika, became intimate with Yoritomo and even had a child of him, Sentsurumaru.

sen.j: 安元元年（1175年）、祐親はこれを知ると、平家の怒りを恐れ千鶴丸を松川に沈めて殺害、さらに頼朝自身の暗殺も図る。
sen.e: In 1175, Sukechika, who found that out, drowned Sentsurumaru in the Matsu-kawa River for fear of invoking the wrath of Heike (the Taira family), and furthermore, he plotted to kill Yoritomo himself.

sen.j: 頼朝の乳母・比企尼の三女を妻としていた子の祐清が頼朝に知らせ、頼朝は夜間馬に乗って熱海の走湯權現に逃げ込み、北条時政の館に匿われて事なきを得たという。
sen.e: Yoritomo was informed of the plot by Sukekiyo who had been married to the third daughter of Hikinoama, Yoritomo's wet nurse, and then, he escaped on a horse at night to Soto-gongen shrine in Atami and was hidden in the residence of Tokimasa HOJO safely.
sen.cmt: ＊「走湯権現」 Soto gongen (sacred mountain)にて用語登録されておりましたが、今回は、山ではなく神社をさすのではと思われ、（参照：http://s-hiraizumi.com/course/soutou/） Soto gongen shrineと訳しました。
sen.e: Yoritomo was informed of the plot by Sukekiyo who had been married to the third daughter of Hikinoama, Yoritomo's wet nurse, and then, he escaped on a horse at night to Soto-gongen shrine in Atami and was hidden in the residence of Tokimasa HOJO safely.

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）に頼朝が挙兵すると、大庭景親らと協力して石橋山の戦いにてこれを撃破する。
sen.e: In 1180, when Yoritomo raised his army, Sukechika ITO destroyed the army in the Battle of Ishibashiyama, in cooperation with Kagechika OBA.

sen.j: しかしやがて勢力を盛り返した頼朝によって逆に追われる身となり、富士川の戦いの後捕らえられ、娘婿の三浦義澄に預けられる。
sen.e: However, subsequently, he became chased by Yoritomo who had re-established his influence, and then, after the Battle of Fujigawa, he was captured and sent to his adopted son-in-law, Yoshizumi MIURA.

sen.j: 義澄による助命嘆願が功を奏し、一時は一命を赦された祐親だが、これを深く恥入り自害して果てた。
sen.e: Sukechika was once saved because Yoshizumi plead for his life, but he felt deeply humiliated by that and committed suicide.

sen.j: 八重姫と千鶴丸のエピソードにより敵役のイメージの強い祐親であるが、地元の伊東市では毎年「伊東祐親まつり」が開催されるなど、郷土の英雄として親しまれているようである。
sen.e: Although Sukechika has a strong image as a villain because of the episode of Yaehime and Sentsurumaru, he seems to be popular as a local hero in his hometown, Ito City, where 'ITO Sukechika Matsuri' (Sukechika ITO festival) has been held every year.
sen.cmt: ＊「伊東祐親まつり」は、Sukechika ITO festivalも、ITO Sukechika festivalも何れも使用されるようでした。ここでは便宜上、左記の表記を採用しました。出典１：www.itospa.com/tour_guide_e/ito-tour-guide_pdf/ito17-18_event.pdf出典２：www.izukyu.jp/foreign_language/en/06.html

sen.j: また曾我兄弟の仇討ち・三浦義村のおじいさんとしても有名である。
sen.e: By the way, Sukechika ITO is also known as the grandfather of the Soga brothers (they avenged their father) and Yoshimura MIURA.
